00046 #define idx_checknelems2_all(src0, src1) \
00047   if ((src0).nelements() != (src1).nelements()) ylerror("incompatible Idx sizes\n");
00048 
00050 #define idx_checknelems3_all(src0, src1, src2) \
00051   if (((src0).nelements() != (src1).nelements()) || \
00052                 ((src0).nelements() != (src2).nelements())) \
00053                 ylerror("incompatible Idx sizes\n");
00054 
00056 #define idx_checkorder1(src0, o0) \
00057   if ((src0).order() != o0) \
00058     ylerror("Idx has wrong order");
00059 
00061 #define idx_checkorder2(src0, o0, src1, o1) \
00062   if (((src0).order() != o0) || ((src1).order() != o1)) \
00063     ylerror("Idx have incompatible orders");
00064 
00066 #define idx_checkorder3(src0, o0, src1, o1, src2, o2) \
00067   if (((src0).order() != o0) || ((src1).order() != o1) || ((src2).order() != o2)) \
00068     ylerror("Idx have incompatible orders");
00069 
00071 #define idx_checkorder3_all(src0, src1, src2) \
00072   if (((src0).order() != (src1).order()) || ((src0).order() != (src2).order())) \
00073     ylerror("Idx have incompatible orders");
00074 
00076 #define idx_checkdim2(src0, d0, e0, src1, d1, e1) \
00077         if (((src0).dim(d0) != e0) || ((src1).dim(d1) != e1))\
00078     ylerror("Idx have incompatible dimensions");
00079 
00081 #define idx_checkdim2_all(src0, src1, d) \
00082         if ((src0).dim(d) != (src1).dim(d)) \
00083     ylerror("Idx have incompatible dimensions");
00084 
00086 #define idx_checkdim3_all(src0, src1, src2, d) \
00087         if (((src0).dim(d) != (src1).dim(d)) || \
00088                         ((src0).dim(d) != (src2).dim(d))) \
00089     ylerror("Idx have incompatible dimensions");
00090 
00093 #define idx_checkdim4_all(src0, src1, src2, src3, d) \
00094         if (((src0).dim(d) != (src1).dim(d)) || \
00095                         ((src0).dim(d) != (src2).dim(d)) || \
00096                         ((src0).dim(d) != (src3).dim(d))) \
00097     ylerror("Idx have incompatible dimensions");
00098

00123 #define cidx1_bloop1(i,p0,src0)         \
00124   if ((src0).order() < 1) ylerror("Idx has wrong order"); \
00125   intg _n0 = (src0).dim(0), _m0 = (src0).mod(0);                \
00126   for (i=0, p0=(src0).idx_ptr(); i<_n0; i++, p0+=_m0) 
00127 
00128 #define cidx1_bloop2(i,p0,src0,p1,src1)          \
00129   if (((src0).order() < 1)||((src1).order() < 1))  ylerror("Idx has wrong order"); \
00130   intg _n0 = (src0).dim(0), _m0 = (src0).mod(0); _m1 = (src1).mod(0);    \
00131   idx_checkdim2_all(src0,src1,0)                                        \
00132   for (i=0, p0=(src0).idx_ptr(), p1=(src1).idx_ptr(); i<_n0; i++, p0+=_m0, p1+=_m1) 
00133 
00134 #define cidx1_bloop3(i,p0,src0,p1,src1,p2,src2)          \
00135   intg _n0 = (src0).dim(0), _m0 = (src0).mod(0), _m1 = (src1).mod(0), _m2 = (src2).mod(0); \
00136   idx_checkdim3_all(src0,src1,src2,0)                                   \
00137   for (i=0, p0=(src0).idx_ptr(), p1=(src1).idx_ptr(), p2=(src2).idx_ptr(); i<_n0; i++, p0+=_m0, p1+=_m1, p2+=_m2) 
00138 
00139 #define cidx1_bloop4(i,p0,src0,p1,src1,p2,src2,p3,src3)  \
00140   intg _n0 = (src0).dim(0), _m0 = (src0).mod(0), _m1 = (src1).mod(0), _m2 = (src2).mod(0), _m3 = (src3).mod(0); \
00141     idx_checkdim4_all(src0,src1,src2,src3,0)                            \
00142     for (i=0, p0=(src0).idx_ptr(), p1=(src1).idx_ptr(), p2=(src2).idx_ptr(), p3=(src3).idx_ptr(); i<_n0; i++, p0+=_m0, p1+=_m1, p2+=_m2, p3+=_m3) 
00143 
00144 
00145 #define cidx2_bloop1(i,j,p0,src0)                         \
00146   if ((src0).order() < 2) ylerror("Idx has wrong order"); \
00147   intg _n00 = (src0).dim(0), _m00 = (src0).mod(0);              \
00148   intg _n01 = (src0).dim(1), _m01 = (src0).mod(1);              \
00149   for (i=0, p0=(src0).idx_ptr(); i<_n00; i++, p0+=_m00-_n01*_m01) \
00150   for (j=0; i<_n01; j++, p0+=_m01) 
00151 
00152 #define cidx2_bloop2(i,j,p0,src0,p1,src1)                 \
00153   if ((src0).order() < 2) ylerror("Idx has wrong order"); \
00154   intg _n00 = (src0).dim(0), _m00 = (src0).mod(0);              \
00155   intg _n01 = (src0).dim(1), _m01 = (src0).mod(1);              \
00156   intg _n10 = (src1).dim(0), _m10 = (src1).mod(0);              \
00157   intg _n11 = (src1).dim(1), _m11 = (src1).mod(1);              \
00158   idx_checkdim2_all(src0,src1,0)                                        \
00159   idx_checkdim2_all(src0,src1,1)                                        \
00160   for (i=0, p0=(src0).idx_ptr(), p1=(src1).idx_ptr(); i<_n00; i++, p0+=_m00-_n01*_m01, p1+=_m10-_n11*_m11) \
00161     for (j=0; i<_n01; j++, p0+=_m01, p1+=_m11) 
00162 
00163 #define cidx2_bloop3(i,j,p0,src0,p1,src1,p2,src2)                 \
00164   if ((src0).order() < 2) ylerror("Idx has wrong order"); \
00165   intg _n00 = (src0).dim(0), _m00 = (src0).mod(0);              \
00166   intg _n01 = (src0).dim(1), _m01 = (src0).mod(1);              \
00167   intg _n10 = (src1).dim(0), _m10 = (src1).mod(0);              \
00168   intg _n11 = (src1).dim(1), _m11 = (src1).mod(1);              \
00169   intg _n20 = (src2).dim(0), _m20 = (src2).mod(0);              \
00170   intg _n21 = (src2).dim(1), _m21 = (src2).mod(1);              \
00171   idx_checkdim3_all(src0,src1,src2,0)                                   \
00172   idx_checkdim3_all(src0,src1,src2,1)                                   \
00173   for (i=0, p0=(src0).idx_ptr(), p1=(src1).idx_ptr(), p2=(src2).idx_ptr(); i<_n00; i++, p0+=_m00-_n01*_m01, p1+=_m10-_n11*_m11, p2+=_m20-_n21*_m21) \
00174     for (j=0; i<_n01; j++, p0+=_m01, p1+=_m11, p2+=_m21)

00187 // bloop/eloop macros
00188 
00189 // Okay, either C++ really suxx0rz or I'm a really st00pid Lisp-head.
00190 // Why can't we define syntax-changing macros like in Lisp? Basically,
00191 // I can't encapsulate the allocation
00192 // of temporary variable for a loop inside the macro, unless
00193 // I define a "begin" macro and an "end" macro. I would like
00194 // to define idx_bloop so I can do:
00195 // idx_bloop2(lm, m, lv, v) { idx_dot(lm,lm,v); }
00196 // but I can't do that because I have to allocate lm and lv
00197 // inside the macro, hence I need to know the type.
00198 // Now the call would be:
00199 // idx_bloop2(lm, m, double, lv, v, double) { idx_dot(lm,lm,v); }
00200 // But that still doesn't quite work because if I declare lm and lv
00201 // then I can't reuse the same symbols for another loop in the same
00202 // scope. The only way out is to force the user to encase every
00203 // bloop call inside braces, or to not reuse the same synbol twice
00204 // for a looping Idx. I thought about generating a mangled name
00205 // but couldn't find a way to make it useful.
00206 // If a macro could define its own scope that would be great.
00207 
00208 
00209 #if USING_STL_ITERS == 1
00210 
00211 #define idx_bloop1(dst0,src0,type0)      \
00212   for ( DimIter<type0> dst0(src0,0); dst0.notdone(); ++dst0)
00213 
00214 #define idx_bloop2(dst0,src0,type0,dst1,src1,type1)                             \
00215   idx_checkdim2_all(src0, src1, 0); \
00216   DimIter<type0> dst0(src0,0); \
00217   DimIter<type1> dst1(src1,0); \
00218   for ( ; dst0.notdone(); ++dst0, ++dst1)
00219 
00220 #define idx_bloop3(dst0,src0,type0,dst1,src1,type1,dst2,src2,type2)     \
00221   idx_checkdim3_all(src0, src1, src2, 0); \
00222   DimIter<type0> dst0(src0,0);                                  \
00223   DimIter<type1> dst1(src1,0);                                  \
00224   DimIter<type2> dst2(src2,0);                                  \
00225   for ( ; dst0.notdone(); ++dst0, ++dst1, ++dst2)
00226 
00227 #define idx_bloop4(dst0,src0,type0,dst1,src1,type1,dst2,src2,type2,dst3,src3,type3) \
00228   idx_checkdim4_all(src0, src1, src2, src3, 0); \
00229   DimIter<type0> dst0(src0,0);                                  \
00230   DimIter<type1> dst1(src1,0);                                  \
00231   DimIter<type2> dst2(src2,0);                                  \
00232   DimIter<type3> dst3(src3,0);                                  \
00233   for ( ; dst0.notdone(); ++dst0, ++dst1, ++dst2, ++dst3)
00234 
00235 // eloop macros
00236 
00237 #define idx_eloop1(dst0,src0,type0) \
00238   DimIter<type0> dst0(src0,src0.order()-1);     \
00239   for ( ; dst0.notdone(); ++dst0)
00240 
00241 #define idx_eloop2(dst0,src0,type0,dst1,src1,type1)                             \
00242   if ( (src0).dim((src0).order()) != (src1).dim((src1).order()) ) ylerror("incompatible Idxs for bloop\n"); \
00243   DimIter<type0> dst0(src0,(src0).order()-1); \
00244   DimIter<type1> dst1(src1,(src1).order()-1); \
00245   for ( ; dst0.notdone(); ++dst0, ++dst1)

00247 
00249 // aloop macros: loop over all elements of an Idx
00250 // These macros are somewhat inefficient and should be used as little
00251 // as possible, or whenever simplicity is preferable to speed.
00252 
00253 // Loops over all elements of an idx. This takes a pointer to
00254 // the data type of idx elements, and a blank IdxIter object:
00255 // idx_aloop1(data_pointer,idxiter,&idx) { do_stuff(data_pointer); }
00256 // Example of use: add 1 to all element of m:
00257 //  Idx<double> m(3,4);
00258 //  ScalarIter<double> p;
00259 //  idx_aloop1(p,&m) { *p += 1; }
00260 #define idx_aloop1_on(itr0,src0)                                        \
00261   for ( ; itr0.notdone(); ++itr0)
00262 
00263 
00264 // this loops simultaneously over all elements of 2 Idxs.
00265 // The two Idxs can have different structures as long as they have
00266 // the same total number of elements.
00267 #define idx_aloop2_on(itr0,src0,itr1,src1)                      \
00268         idx_checknelems2_all(src0, src1); \
00269   for ( ; itr0.notdone(); ++itr0, ++itr1)
00270 
00271 
00272 #define idx_aloop3_on(itr0,src0,itr1,src1,itr2,src2)    \
00273         idx_checknelems3_all(src0, src1, src2); \
00274   for (; itr0.notdone(); ++itr0, ++itr1, ++itr2)
00275 
00276 
00277 // high level aloop macros.
00278 // These should be enclosed in braces, to avoid name clashes
00279 #define idx_aloop1(itr0,src0,type0) \
00280   ScalarIter<type0> itr0(src0); \
00281   idx_aloop1_on(itr0,src0)
00282 
00283 
00284 #define idx_aloop2(itr0,src0,type0,itr1,src1,type1)             \
00285   ScalarIter<type0> itr0(src0); \
00286   ScalarIter<type1> itr1(src1); \
00287   idx_checknelems2_all(src0, src1); \
00288   for (; itr0.notdone(); ++itr0, ++itr1)
00289 
00290 #define idx_aloop3(itr0,src0,type0,itr1,src1,type1,itr2,src2,type2) \
00291   ScalarIter<type0> itr0(src0); \
00292   ScalarIter<type1> itr1(src1); \
00293   ScalarIter<type2> itr2(src2); \
00294   idx_checknelems3_all(src0, src1, src2); \
00295   for (; itr0.notdone(); ++itr0, ++itr1, ++itr2)
00296 
00297 #else
00298 
00299 #define idx_bloop1(dst0,src0,type0)      \
00300   IdxLooper<type0> dst0(src0,0); \
00301   for ( ; dst0.notdone(); dst0.next())
00302 
00303 #define idx_bloop2(dst0,src0,type0,dst1,src1,type1)                             \
00304   idx_checkdim2_all(src0, src1, 0); \
00305   IdxLooper<type0> dst0(src0,0); \
00306   IdxLooper<type1> dst1(src1,0); \
00307   for ( ; dst0.notdone(); dst0.next(), dst1.next())
00308 
00309 #define idx_bloop3(dst0,src0,type0,dst1,src1,type1,dst2,src2,type2)     \
00310   idx_checkdim3_all(src0, src1, src2, 0); \
00311   IdxLooper<type0> dst0(src0,0);                                        \
00312   IdxLooper<type1> dst1(src1,0);                                        \
00313   IdxLooper<type2> dst2(src2,0);                                        \
00314   for ( ; dst0.notdone(); dst0.next(), dst1.next(), dst2.next())
00315 
00316 #define idx_bloop4(dst0,src0,type0,dst1,src1,type1,dst2,src2,type2,dst3,src3,type3) \
00317   idx_checkdim4_all(src0, src1, src2, src3, 0); \
00318   IdxLooper<type0> dst0(src0,0);                                        \
00319   IdxLooper<type1> dst1(src1,0);                                        \
00320   IdxLooper<type2> dst2(src2,0);                                        \
00321   IdxLooper<type3> dst3(src3,0);                                        \
00322   for ( ; dst0.notdone(); dst0.next(), dst1.next(), dst2.next(), dst3.next())
00323 
00324 // eloop macros
00325 
00326 #define idx_eloop1(dst0,src0,type0) \
00327   IdxLooper<type0> dst0(src0,src0.order()-1);   \
00328   for ( ; dst0.notdone(); dst0.next())
00329 
00330 #define idx_eloop2(dst0,src0,type0,dst1,src1,type1)                             \
00331   if ( (src0).dim((src0).order()) != (src1).dim((src1).order()) ) ylerror("incompatible Idxs for bloop\n"); \
00332   IdxLooper<type0> dst0(src0,(src0).order()-1); \
00333   IdxLooper<type1> dst1(src1,(src1).order()-1); \
00334   for ( ; dst0.notdone(); dst0.next(), dst1.next())

00336 
00338 // aloop macros: loop over all elements
00339 
00340 // Loops over all elements of an idx. This takes a pointer to
00341 // the data type of idx elements, and a blank IdxIter object:
00342 // idx_aloop1(data_pointer,idxiter,&idx) { do_stuff(data_pointer); }
00343 // Example of use: add 1 to all element of m:
00344 //  Idx<double> m(3,4);
00345 //  IdxIter<double> p;
00346 //  idx_aloop1(p,&m) { *p += 1; }
00347 #define idx_aloop1_on(itr0,src0)                                        \
00348   for ( itr0.init(src0); itr0.notdone(); itr0.next())
00349 
00350 
00351 // this loops simultaneously over all elements of 2 Idxs.
00352 // The two Idxs can have different structures as long as they have
00353 // the same total number of elements.
00354 #define idx_aloop2_on(itr0,src0,itr1,src1)                      \
00355         idx_checknelems2_all(src0, src1); \
00356   for ( itr0.init(src0), itr1.init(src1); itr0.notdone(); itr0.next(), itr1.next())
00357 
00358 #define idx_aloop3_on(itr0,src0,itr1,src1,itr2,src2)    \
00359         idx_checknelems3_all(src0, src1, src2); \
00360   for (itr0.init(src0), itr1.init(src1), itr2.init(src2); itr0.notdone(); itr0.next(), itr1.next(), itr2.next())
00361 
00362 // high level aloop macros.
00363 // These should be enclosed in braces, to avoid name clashes
00364 #define idx_aloop1(itr0,src0,type0) \
00365   IdxIter<type0> itr0; \
00366   idx_aloop1_on(itr0,src0)
00367 
00368 #define idx_aloop2(itr0,src0,type0,itr1,src1,type1)             \
00369   IdxIter<type0> itr0; \
00370   IdxIter<type0> itr1; \
00371         idx_checknelems2_all(src0, src1); \
00372   for (itr0.init(src0), itr1.init(src1); itr0.notdone(); itr0.next(), itr1.next())
00373 
00374 #define idx_aloop3(itr0,src0,type0,itr1,src1,type1,itr2,src2,type2) \
00375   IdxIter<type0> itr0; \
00376   IdxIter<type0> itr1; \
00377   IdxIter<type0> itr2; \
00378         idx_checknelems3_all(src0, src1, src2); \
00379   for (itr0.init(src0), itr1.init(src1), itr2.init(src2); itr0.notdone(); itr0.next(), itr1.next(), itr2.next())
00380 
00381 #endif // if USING_STL_ITERS, else

00384 // Idx methods
00385 
00386 template <class T> void Idx<T>::growstorage() {
00387   if ( storage->growsize(spec.footprint()) < 0) {
00388     ylerror("cannot grow storage");
00389   }
00390 }
00391 
00392 template <class T> void Idx<T>::growstorage_chunk(intg s_chunk){
00393         if( storage->growsize_chunk(spec.footprint(), s_chunk) < 0) {
00394                 ylerror("cannot grow storage");
00395         }
00396 }
00397 
00398 /* the constructor doesn't exist and I didn't find one to replace it
00399 template<typename T>
00400 void Idx<T>::printElems(FILE* filePtr){
00401         this->printElems(std::ofstream(filePtr));
00402 }
00403 */
00404 
00405 template <typename T>
00406 void Idx<T>::printElems( std::ostream& out ){
00407         printElems_impl(0, out);
00408 }
00409 
00410 template <typename T>
00411 void Idx<T>::printElems(){
00412         this->printElems( std::cout );
00413 }
00414 
00415 template<class T> inline T printElems_impl_cast(T val) {
00416         return val;
00417 }
00418 
00419 // specialization for ubyte to print as unsigned integers.
00420 inline unsigned int printElems_impl_cast(ubyte val) {
00421         return (unsigned int) val;
00422 }
00423 
00424 template <typename T>
00425 void Idx<T>::printElems_impl( int indent, std::ostream& out ){
00426         static const std::string lbrace = "[";
00427         static const std::string rbrace = "]";
00428         static const std::string sep = " ";
00429         std::ostringstream oss;
00430         for( unsigned int ii = 0; ii < lbrace.length(); ++ii ){
00431                 oss<<" ";
00432         }
00433         const std::string tab(oss.str());
00434 
00435         // printing a 0-dimensional tensor
00436         if( order() == 0 ){
00437                 out<<lbrace<<"@"<<sep<< printElems_impl_cast(get()) <<sep<<rbrace<<"\n";
00438         }
00439         // printing a 1-D tensor
00440         else if( order() == 1 ){
00441                 out<<lbrace<<sep;
00442                 for( int ii = 0; ii < dim(0); ++ii ){
00443                         out<< printElems_impl_cast(get(ii)) <<sep;
00444                 }
00445                 out<<rbrace<<"\n";
00446         }
00447         // printing a multidimensional tensor
00448         else{
00449 
00450                 // opening brace
00451                 out<<lbrace;
00452 
00453                 // print subtensors.
00454                 Idx<T> subtensor(storage, spec.offset);
00455                 for( int dimInd = 0; dimInd < dim(0); ++dimInd ){
00456 
00457                         // only print indent if this isn't the first subtensor.
00458                         if( dimInd > 0 ){
00459                                 for( int ii = 0; ii < indent+1; ++ii ){
00460                                         out<<(tab);
00461                                 }
00462                         }
00463 
00464                         // print subtensor
00465                         spec.select_into(&subtensor.spec, 0, dimInd);
00466                         subtensor.printElems_impl( indent+1, out );
00467 
00468                         // only print the newline if this isn't the last subtensor.
00469                         if( dimInd < (dim(0)-1)){
00470                                 out<<"\n";
00471                         }
00472 
00473                 }
00474 
00475                 // closing brace
00476                 out<<rbrace<<"\n";
00477         }
00478 }
00479 
00480 template <class T> void Idx<T>::pretty(FILE *f) {
00481   fprintf(f,"Idx: at address %ld\n",(intg)this);
00482   fprintf(f,"  storage=%ld (size=%ld)\n",(intg)storage,storage->size());
00483   spec.pretty(f);
00484 }
00485 
00486 template <class T> void Idx<T>::pretty(std::ostream& out){
00487         out << "Idx: at address " << (intg)this << "\n";
00488         out << "  storage=" <<  (intg)storage << "(size=" << storage->size() << "\n";
00489         spec.pretty(out);
00490 }

00492 template <class T> Idx<T>::~Idx() {
00493   DEBUG("Idx::destructor %ld\n",long(this));
00494   storage->unlock();
00495 }

00588 template <class T> intg Idx<T>::setoffset(intg o) {
00589   if (o<0) { ylerror("Idx::setoffset: offset must be positive"); }
00590   if (o > spec.offset) {
00591     spec.setoffset(o);
00592     growstorage();
00593     return o;
00594   } else {
00595     spec.setoffset(o);
00596     return o;
00597   }
00598 }

00601   spec.resize(s0,s1,s2,s3,s4,s5,s6,s7);
00602   growstorage();

00627 template <class T> Idx<T> Idx<T>::select(int d, intg i) {
00628   Idx<T> r(storage,spec.getoffset());
00629   spec.select_into(&r.spec, d, i);
00630   return r;
00631 }

00633 template <class T> Idx<T> Idx<T>::narrow(int d, intg s, intg o) {
00634   Idx<T> r(storage,spec.getoffset());
00635   spec.narrow_into(&r.spec, d, s, o);
00636   return r;
00637 }

00639 template <class T> Idx<T> Idx<T>::transpose(int d1, int d2) {
00640   Idx<T> r(storage,spec.getoffset());
00641   spec.transpose_into(&r.spec, d1, d2);
00642   return r;
00643 }
00644 
00645 template <class T> Idx<T> Idx<T>::transpose(int *p) {
00646   Idx<T> r(storage,spec.getoffset());
00647   spec.transpose_into(&r.spec, p);
00648   return r;
00649 }
00650 
00651 template <class T> Idx<T> Idx<T>::unfold(int d, intg k, intg s) {
00652   Idx<T> r(storage,spec.getoffset());
00653   spec.unfold_into(&r.spec, d, k, s);
00654   return r;
00655 }

00659 // access methods
00660 
00661 // get element of Idx1
00662 template <class T> T *Idx<T>::ptr(intg i0) {
00663   if (spec.ndim != 1) ylerror("not an Idx1");
00664   if ((i0 < 0) || (i0 >= spec.dim[0])) ylerror("index 0 out of bound");
00665   return storage->data + spec.offset + i0*spec.mod[0];
00666 }
00667 
00668 // get element of Idx2
00669 template <class T> T *Idx<T>::ptr(intg i0, intg i1) {
00670   if (spec.ndim != 2) ylerror("not an Idx2");
00671   if ((i0 < 0) || (i0 >= spec.dim[0])) ylerror("index 0 out of bound");
00672   if ((i1 < 0) || (i1 >= spec.dim[1])) ylerror("index 1 out of bound");
00673   return storage->data + spec.offset + i0*spec.mod[0] + i1*spec.mod[1];
00674 }
00675 
00676 // get element of Idx3
00677 template <class T> T *Idx<T>::ptr(intg i0, intg i1, intg i2) {
00678   if (spec.ndim != 3) ylerror("not an Idx3");
00679   if ((i0 < 0) || (i0 >= spec.dim[0])) ylerror("index 0 out of bound");
00680   if ((i1 < 0) || (i1 >= spec.dim[1])) ylerror("index 1 out of bound");
00681   if ((i2 < 0) || (i2 >= spec.dim[2])) ylerror("index 2 out of bound");
00682   return storage->data + spec.offset + i0*spec.mod[0] + i1*spec.mod[1] + i2*spec.mod[2];
00683 }
00684 
00685 
00686 // return a pointer to an element of an Idx
00687 // generic function for order>3
00688 template <class T> T *Idx<T>::ptr(intg i0, intg i1, intg i2, intg i3, intg i4, intg i5, intg i6, intg i7) {
00689   try {
00690     // check that we passed the right number of indices
00691     // and that they are all positive
00692     switch (spec.ndim) {
00693     case 8: if (i7 < 0) throw(-8);break;
00694     case 7: if ((i6 < 0) || (i7 != -1)) throw(-7);break;
00695     case 6: if ((i5 < 0) || (i6 != -1)) throw(-6);break;
00696     case 5: if ((i4 < 0) || (i5 != -1)) throw(-5);break;
00697     case 4: if ((i3<0)||(i2<0)||(i1<0)||(i0<0)||(i4 != -1)) throw(-4);break;
00698     default: throw(10);
00699     }
00700     // now compute offset, and check that all
00701     // indices are within bounds.
00702     intg k = 0;
00703     switch (spec.ndim) {
00704     case 8: k += spec.mod[7]*i7; if (i7 >= spec.dim[7])  throw(7);
00705     case 7: k += spec.mod[6]*i6; if (i6 >= spec.dim[6])  throw(6);
00706     case 6: k += spec.mod[5]*i5; if (i5 >= spec.dim[5])  throw(5);
00707     case 5: k += spec.mod[4]*i4; if (i4 >= spec.dim[4])  throw(4);
00708     case 4: k += spec.mod[3]*i3; if (i3 >= spec.dim[3])  throw(3);
00709     }
00710     k += spec.mod[2]*i2; if (i2 >= spec.dim[2])  throw(2);
00711     k += spec.mod[1]*i1; if (i1 >= spec.dim[1])  throw(1);
00712     k += spec.mod[0]*i0; if (i0 >= spec.dim[0])  throw(0);
00713     return storage->data + spec.offset + k;
00714   }
00715   catch(int k) {
00716     if (k==10) ylerror("Idx::get: number of indices and order are different");
00717     if (k < 0) {
00718       ylerror("Idx::get: wrong number of indices, or negative index");
00719     } else {
00720       ylerror("Idx::get: index out of bound");
00721     }
00722     return NULL;
00723   }
00724 }
00725

00729 // get element of Idx0
00730 template <class T> T Idx<T>::get() {
00731   if (spec.ndim != 0) ylerror("not an Idx0");
00732   return (storage->data)[spec.offset];
00733 }
00734 
00735 // get element of Idx1
00736 template <class T> T Idx<T>::get(intg i0) {
00737   if (spec.ndim != 1) ylerror("not an Idx1");
00738   if ((i0 < 0) || (i0 >= spec.dim[0])) ylerror("index 0 out of bound");
00739   return (storage->data)[spec.offset + i0*spec.mod[0]];
00740 }
00741 
00742 // get element of Idx2
00743 template <class T> T Idx<T>::get(intg i0, intg i1) {
00744   if (spec.ndim != 2) ylerror("not an Idx2");
00745   if ((i0 < 0) || (i0 >= spec.dim[0])) ylerror("index 0 out of bound");
00746   if ((i1 < 0) || (i1 >= spec.dim[1])) ylerror("index 1 out of bound");
00747   return (storage->data)[spec.offset + i0*spec.mod[0] + i1*spec.mod[1]];
00748 }
00749 
00750 // get element of Idx3
00751 template <class T> T Idx<T>::get(intg i0, intg i1, intg i2) {
00752   if (spec.ndim != 3) ylerror("not an Idx3");
00753   if ((i0 < 0) || (i0 >= spec.dim[0])) ylerror("index 0 out of bound");
00754   if ((i1 < 0) || (i1 >= spec.dim[1])) ylerror("index 1 out of bound");
00755   if ((i2 < 0) || (i2 >= spec.dim[2])) ylerror("index 2 out of bound");
00756   return (storage->data)[spec.offset + i0*spec.mod[0] + i1*spec.mod[1] + i2*spec.mod[2]];
00757 }

00759 // get element of an Idx of any order
00760 template <class T> T Idx<T>::get(intg i0, intg i1, intg i2, intg i3, intg i4, intg i5, intg i6, intg i7) {
00761   return *ptr(i0,i1,i2,i3,i4,i5,i6,i7);
00762 }

00769   if (spec.ndim != 0) ylerror("not an Idx0");
00770   return (storage->data)[spec.offset] = val;
00771 }

00776   if ((i0 < 0) || (i0 >= spec.dim[0])) ylerror("index 0 out of bound");
00777   return (storage->data)[spec.offset + i0*spec.mod[0]] = val;

00783   if ((i0 < 0) || (i0 >= spec.dim[0])) ylerror("index 0 out of bound");
00784   if ((i1 < 0) || (i1 >= spec.dim[1])) ylerror("index 1 out of bound");
00785   return (storage->data)[spec.offset + i0*spec.mod[0] + i1*spec.mod[1]] = val;

00788 // set the element of Idx3

00790   if (spec.ndim != 3) ylerror("not an Idx3");
00791   if ((i0 < 0) || (i0 >= spec.dim[0])) ylerror("index 0 out of bound");
00792   if ((i1 < 0) || (i1 >= spec.dim[1])) ylerror("index 1 out of bound");
00793   if ((i2 < 0) || (i2 >= spec.dim[2])) ylerror("index 2 out of bound");
00794   return (storage->data)[spec.offset + i0*spec.mod[0] + i1*spec.mod[1] + i2*spec.mod[2]] = val;
00795 }

00798 // set an element of an Idx of any order.
00799 template <class T> T Idx<T>::set(T val, intg i0, intg i1, intg i2, intg i3, intg i4, intg i5, intg i6, intg i7) {
00800     return *ptr(i0,i1,i2,i3,i4,i5,i6,i7) = val;
00801 }
00802 
00803 template <class T> int Idx<T>::fdump(FILE *f) {
00804   if (spec.ndim == 0) {
00805     fprintf(f,"[@ %g]\n",this->get());
00806   } else if (spec.ndim == 1) {
00807     fprintf(f,"[");
00808     for (intg i=0; i<dim(0); i += mod(0)) {
00809       fprintf(f,"%g ",(storage->data)[spec.offset + i]);
00810     }
00811     fprintf(f,"]\n");
00812   } else {
00813     fprintf(f,"[");
00814     { idx_bloop1(p,*this,T) { p.fdump(f); } }
00815     fprintf(f,"]\n");
00816   }
00817   return 0;
00818 }

00863 #if USING_STL_ITERS == 0
00865 // an IdxLooper is an iterator for Idxs.
00866 // It is actually a subclass of Idx.
00867 // These are not C++ iterators in the classical sense.
00868 
00869 template <class T> IdxLooper<T>::IdxLooper(Idx<T> &idx, int ld) : Idx<T>((dummyt*)0) {
00870   i = 0;
00871   dimd = idx.spec.dim[ld];
00872   modd = idx.spec.mod[ld];
00873   idx.spec.select_into(&(this->spec), ld, i);
00874   this->storage = idx.storage;
00875   this->storage->lock();
00876 }
00877 
00878 // like ++
00879 // CAUTION: this doesn't do array bound checking
00880 // because we coudn't use a for loop if it did.
00881 template <class T> T *IdxLooper<T>::next() {
00882   i++;
00883   this->spec.offset += modd;
00884   return this->storage->data + this->spec.offset;
00885 }
00886 
00887 // return true when done.
00888 template <class T> bool IdxLooper<T>::notdone() { return ( i < dimd ); }
00889 
00890 
00892 // a pointer that loops over all elements
00893 // of an Idx
00894 
00895 // empty constructor;
00896 template <class T> IdxIter<T>::IdxIter() { };
00897 
00898 template <class T> T *IdxIter<T>::init(Idx<T> &idx) {
00899   iterand = &idx;
00900   i = 0;
00901   j = iterand->spec.ndim;
00902   data = iterand->storage->data + iterand->spec.offset;
00903   if (iterand->spec.contiguousp()) {
00904     d[0] = -1;
00905   } else {
00906     for(int i=0; i < iterand->spec.ndim; i++) { d[i] = 0; }
00907   }
00908   n = iterand->spec.nelements();
00909   return data;
00910 }
00911 
00912 template <class T> T *IdxIter<T>::next() {
00913   i++;
00914   if (d[0] < 0) {
00915     // contiguous Idx
00916     data++;
00917   } else {
00918     // non-contiguous Idx
00919     j--;
00920     do {
00921       if (j<0) break;
00922       if (++d[j] < iterand->spec.dim[j]) {
00923         data += iterand->spec.mod[j];
00924         j++;
00925       } else {
00926         data -= iterand->spec.dim[j] * iterand->spec.mod[j];
00927         d[j--] = -1;
00928       }
00929     } while (j < iterand->spec.ndim);
00930   }
00931   return data;
00932 }
00933 
00934 template <class T> bool IdxIter<T>::notdone() { return ( i < n ); }
00935 
00936 #endif // IF USING_STL_ITERS == 1
